intro: Erigeron californicus, commonly known as California fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron californicus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
